results.title: Vision. [No. 29]
results.creator_credit: United States Information Agency, SA Films and Sidney R Aronson
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine: Mt Copper, Colorado - hot dog skiing, free style; Korczak Ziolkowski, mountain carver - Memorial to Chief Crazy Horse being carved at Thunderhead Mountain; Music on the move - St Paul Chamber Orchestra; Driverless vehicles - “robots” in Detroit’s Harpers Hospital move through specially designed tunnels and corridors, take their own elevators and carry food, linen and supplies; Richard Petty, racecar driver - winner of over 150 US Grand National races. Narrated by Michael Tolan.
results.creator_credit_for_label: United States Information Agency, SA Films and Sidney R Aronson

Narrated by Michael Tolan.

results.title: Vision. [No. 28]
results.creator_credit: United States Information Agency, Ted Steeg Productions and Ted Steeg
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine: Colleges in America teach puppetry; US Patent Office grants exclusive rights to and protects all new inventions; an aerial circus; an exploration of how solar energy houses work and some examples; Girls’ Basketball Tournament in Iowa is complete with bands, beauty queens and drill teams; Thoreau’s Walden Pond philosophy he created when he lived in the wilderness.

results.title: Vision. [No. 27]
results.creator_credit: United States Information Agency, SA Films and Sidney R Aronson
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine: Senior softball - a softball league whose players are all 75 years of age or older; Busch Gardens - where people enjoy riding, animal shows etc; Hamburger University - the school training thoe who operate McDonald’s restaurants; house-on-the rocks - a ‘castle in the sky’ perched on top of a rugged 450 foot high chimney rock; Harpers Ferry - John Sergem, wood carver, creates plaques, busts and other exhibits for display in national parks; Eva Jessye - one of the great names in Black American music.

results.title: Vision. [No. 26]
results.creator_credit: United States Information Agency, Ted Steeg Productions, Jim Strongin and Ted Steeg
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine: School of the Arts; Los Angeles Freeway; fish farming with the Lummis - an Indian tgribe has mastered the science of fish-farming; frostbiting - people who sail all year round braving winter winds and temperatures; homesteading - deserted town houses are granted to citizens willing to make them liveable again; head in the stars - Ken Kulak, 12 years old, runs a planetarium and studies computer sciences and astronomy; Theater of the Deaf - a repertory company tours the world performing for deaf and non-deaf people alike.

results.title: Vision. [No. 24]
results.creator_credit: United States Information Agency, Ted Steeg Productions, Tim Strongin and Ted Steeg
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine: Volunteers look after young abandoned eagles; New Pacemaker developed by the John Hopkins Applied Physics Laboratory; a sheep farm family business in Bucks County, Pennsylvania; San Francisco preserves its heritage by retaining its cable cars; an island of peace minutes away from Times Square in New York City; A New York high school has a special class for young rock music composers.

results.title: Vision. [No. 22]
results.creator_credit: United States Information Agency, Ted Steeg Productions, Jim Strongin and Ted Steeg
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine: the work and use of the radio telescope in West Virginia; a policewoman explains her job, training and off duty life in Washington; problems of the retired and the handicapped as tackled by the Retired Senior Volunteer Program; making dolls to reflect authentic period in American history; the cleaning up of Lake Washington by the community in Seattle and the 18 acre San Diego Wild Animal Park which aims to reproduce in captivity animals which otherwise might become extinct. Narrated by Michael Tolan.
results.creator_credit_for_label: United States Information Agency, Ted Steeg Productions, Jim Strongin and Ted Steeg
